meanings.definition: To make someone feel happier or more cheerful.
meanings.sent1: She jollied her friend by telling funny stories.
meanings.sent2: The clown jollied up the atmosphere with his jokes.
meanings.sent3: The cheerful puppy jollied everyone up with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The colorful decorations jollied up the dull room.
meanings.sent5: The lively music jollied the party into full swing.

meanings.definition: To tease or joke with someone in a playful manner.
meanings.sent1: He jollied his brother by pretending to steal his snack.
meanings.sent2: The friends jollied each other about their favorite sports teams.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat jollied the dog by hiding its toy.
meanings.sent4: The siblings jollied around, laughing and joking all day.
meanings.sent5: The comedian jollied the audience with his witty remarks.
